message_1:
In a study to determine the effectiveness of a new fertilizer, a farmer randomly selected 50 plots of land and divided them equally into two groups: one group was treated with the new fertilizer, while the other group was not treated. After 3 months, the yield of corn was recorded for each plot. The data is shown below:

New Fertilizer Group: 132, 145, 152, 160, 164, 165, 166, 168, 169, 171, 172, 174, 175, 177, 178, 179, 181, 185, 186, 188, 188, 190, 191, 192, 193, 195, 196, 197, 198, 199, 200, 200, 202, 203, 206, 209, 211, 215, 220, 222, 224, 225, 229, 230, 232, 236, 238, 240, 246, 250

Control Group: 126, 129, 130, 143, 148, 150, 155, 157, 159, 162, 163, 166, 170, 172, 176, 178, 179, 180, 183, 189, 190, 191, 193, 196, 198, 202, 206, 209, 212, 215, 220, 223, 226, 229, 231, 235, 237, 239, 241, 243, 246, 248, 250, 251, 252, 255, 257, 259, 261, 263

Calculate the mean and standard deviation of the yield for each group, and construct a boxplot for each group. What can you conclude about the effectiveness of the new fertilizer?
message_2:
First, let's calculate the mean and standard deviation for each group.

New Fertilizer Group:
Mean: (sum of all yields) / 50 = (10234) / 50 = 204.68
Standard Deviation: sqrt((sum of (yield - mean)^2) / 49) = sqrt(12334.16 / 49) = 16.03

Control Group:
Mean: (sum of all yields) / 50 = (10134) / 50 = 202.68
Standard Deviation: sqrt((sum of (yield - mean)^2) / 49) = sqrt(13034.16 / 49) = 16.47

Now, let's construct the boxplots for each group.

New Fertilizer Group:
Q1 (25th percentile): 175
Q2 (50th percentile, median): 193
Q3 (75th percentile): 224
IQR (Interquartile Range): Q3 - Q1 = 224 - 175 = 49

Control Group:
Q1 (25th percentile): 170
Q2 (50th percentile, median): 191
Q3 (75th percentile): 229
IQR (Interquartile Range): Q3 - Q1 = 229 - 170 = 59

From the calculated mean and boxplots, we can observe that the New Fertilizer Group has a slightly higher mean yield (204.68) compared to the Control Group (202.68). The boxplots also show that the New Fertilizer Group has a slightly higher median yield (193) compared to the Control Group (191). However, the difference in mean and median yields is not very significant.

The standard deviations for both groups are quite similar, with the New Fertilizer Group having a slightly lower standard deviation (16.03) compared to the Control Group (16.47). This indicates that the yields in the New Fertilizer Group are slightly less spread out than those in the Control Group.

In conclusion, the new fertilizer seems to have a small positive effect on the yield of corn, as the mean and median yields are slightly higher for the New Fertilizer Group compared to the Control Group. However, the difference is not very significant, and further studies with larger sample sizes or more controlled conditions may be needed to draw a stronger conclusion about the effectiveness of the new fertilizer.
